thread.title: There’s no mutiny with offshore cook’s dishes
thread.title_full: There’s no mutiny with offshore cook’s dishes

title: There’s no mutiny with offshore cook’s dishes
text:
There’s no mutiny with offshore cook’s dishes Margaret Warr, News Journal correspondent 4:27 p.m. CDT September 29, 2015 Salmon (Photo: Phillip Makselan/H&G/pnj.com) 
Andre Nelson has loads of experience cooking. For many years, he prepared three meals a day for hungry offshore crews. With his chopping, dicing and stirring, he has perfected tantalizing dishes. Some of his most popular signature dishes are flank steak and baked salmon with cucumber sauce. 
Even though the flank steak only needs to be marinated 10 minutes, it cooks up juicy and tender. Using a sharp knife, slice it across the grain in thin pieces. The salmon can be baked up in a snap. Cucumber sauce makes a delicious must-have accompaniment to the salmon.
